ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My independent study with Professor Mirakhor was deeply enriching. I learned how to put a range of texts--fiction, theory, critical reviews, documentaries, etc.--in conversation with one another in order to produce new insights. Professor Mirakhor encouraged me to drive a lot of our discussions, which enabled me to practice valuable organizational and critical thinking skills. Not only do I feel more capable of speaking with greater clarity and intentionality, but my writing feels more precise than ever.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course really has no weaknesses. Its strength lies in its multifaceted syllabus, including documentaries, interviews, literary reviews, short stories, theory, as well as novels. This course is a testament to the ways in which critical engagement is a practice that extends beyond the work and research commonly associated with academia. In other words, theory and traditional scholarship are not the only pieces that are worth critical engagement. I felt as though there was a lot at stake in the work we pursued in the course, it was meaningful in a way that many other courses I have taken have not been.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would highly encourage any student at Yale to take a course with Professor Mirakhor.
